newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Jollibee says '96 net up on higher sales.
newsitem.headline: Jollibee says '96 net up on higher sales.

text.p: Jollibee Foods Corp, a leader in Philippine fastfood industry, said on Thursday its net profit rose 12 percent to 603 million pesos in 1996 from 537 million pesos in 1995 due to robust sales and improved efficiency.
Revenues increased by 34 percent to a record 6.61 billion pesos from 4.92 billion following its expansion programme.
Income from operations grew 29 percent to 845 million pesos from 657 million pesos, the company said.

"The buoyant consumer demand brought about by the healthy economy and the strong overseas remittances resulted in continuing advances in domestic sales volume, said Raffy de la Rosa, the company's chief finance officer.
De la Rosa said earnings were within expectations.
Borrowings to finance the company's expansion and modernization programme had tempered profit growth, he said.
Jollibee has a total of 208 stores nationwide, of which 40 were opened in 1996.
The company also said its division Greenwich pizza-pasta had also started contributing to sales significantly. It opened 28 branches in 1996 which brought the total to 80.
